exam.question: You would like to create a web application by using HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3. Which of the following Visual Studio 2012 editions can you use? (Choose all that apply.)
You would like to create a Windows 8 application by using HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3. Which of the following Visual Studio 2012 editions can you use? (Choose all that apply.)

You would like to create web applications and Windows 8 Windows Store applications by using HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3, but while you"re learning, you don"t want to buy Visual Studio 2012. Which of the following Visual Studio 2012 editions can you use for free to accomplish your goal?

answers.d: Visual Studio Express 2012 for Web and Visual Studio Express 2012 for Windows 8

exam.question: You would like to create a Windows 8 application by using Blend and HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS3. Which feature of Blend enables you to pause an application when it reaches a desired state so you can set the style rules for the page and its controls while in this state? (Choose all that apply.)
On which panel can you see a hierarchically structured view of the DOM?
Which panel can you use to access a list of the HTML elements, controls, and media that can be added to an HTML page that is open in the artboard?

You want to create an expando attribute on several <h3> tags that display vehicles for sale. The expando attribute will store the VIN (vehicle identification number) of the vehicle for sale. Which of the following is the most appropriate example of creating the expando attribute?
Which technology is HTML5 preceded by and derived from?
How should you start each HTML5 document?
You want to use the disabled Boolean attribute on a text box. How can you accomplish this? (Choose all that apply.)
You want to embed a Flash file called myFlash.swf in your HTML document. Which is the most appropriate code?

You want to create a drawing of a machine that Contoso, Ltd., will be selling on its website. The drawing will be embedded in your HTML document, and you want it to maintain its quality when resized. Which is the most appropriate file type to use?

Your application prompts the user to enter his or her age, which is placed in an age variable. A user ran the application and entered I Don"t Know for the age. The application then multiplies age by two. What is the result?
Which of the following represent valid variable declarations? (Choose all that apply.)

In your application, you want to display a personalized message to the user, if the user"s name is populated, in the userName variable, but if userName is empty, you want to use Valued User instead. How can you accomplish this most efficiently?
You are creating a new Windows 8 application, and you want to set up TDD for your JavaScript code. Which testing framework will you use?
What are the steps for TDD?

answers.a: Write the passing test, write the code, run the test again to validate that it still passes.
answers.b: Write the failing test, write the code, run the test again to validate that it passes.
answers.c: Write the code, write the test to validate that it passes, run the test again to validate that it still passes.
answers.d: Write the passing test, write the code, break the code, run the test again to validate that it fails.

exam.question: Where should your JavaScript code be placed?

answers.a: In the <head> element of your HTML document.
answers.c: You should always place your JavaScript code in separate files, external to your HTML document.
answers.d: Inside the <body> element, at the top.

exam.question: You want to add a comment to your style sheet that says "temporary." Which is the proper line to add to the CSS file?
You want to maintain separation between structure and presentation. How do you create your style rules?

answers.d: In the HTML document, specify @import to load style sheets.

exam.question: You want your printer.css style sheet to target printers. How would you set up the style sheet link?
You want to set the style of the first letter of every paragraph in a <div> element whose id is readingPane. Which style selector is most appropriate?

The following style sheet rule is defined in Corporate.css.
div p.highlight{
    font-size: xx-large;
    background-color: yellow;
}

In Department.css, the following style sheet rule is defined.
div p {
    background-color: blue;
}

Your HTML document contains the following.
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
    <title></title>
    <link href="Corporate.css" rel="stylesheet" />
    <link href="Department.css" rel="stylesheet" />
</head>
<body>
    <div id="readingPane">
       <p class="highlight">
            Here is a test to see what the background color of a paragraph
            will be blue or yellow.
        </p>
    </div>
   </body>
</html>

What will be the rendered background color of the paragraph?

The following style sheet rule is defined in Corporate.css.
div p.highlight{
    font-size: xx-large;
    background-color: yellow;
}
In Department.css, the following style sheet rule is defined.
div p:first-of-type. {
    background-color: blue;
}
Your HTML document contains the following.
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
    <title></title>
    <link href="Corporate.css" rel="stylesheet" />
    <link href="Department.css" rel="stylesheet" />
</head>
<body>
    <div id="readingPane">
        <p class="highlight">
            Here is a test to see what the background color of a paragraph
            will be blue or yellow.
        </p>
    </div>
   </body>
</html>
What will be the rendered background color of the paragraph?
You want to find three shades of a color to use on parts of your webpage. Which color function helps you accomplish this task?
A font that has curls at the top and bottom of its characters belongs to which font family group?
You want to position a <div> element in relation to the browser window. Which position setting do you use?
You are creating a webpage that will display short stories, and you want the stories to be shareable on other sites. Which element should each story be wrapped with?
You want to indicate an important item in your content text. Which element do you use?
You want to identify the author of webpages on your website by providing the author name and email address in the footer of each page. What is the proper way to do this?

You are creating a webpage that will be used to display a list of salespeople with their sales statistics for the years of 2010, 2011, and 2012 in two categories: sales of products and sales of services. You want to each of the years to be in the horizontal header, and under each year, you will have a "Products" column and a "Services" column. How will you define the element for year 2011?
You want to provide the ability to display or show columns, but you don"t want to add a style or other marking to each <td> element. How can you accomplish this?

answers.a: Add a <colgroup> element to the <table> element and define each column by using a <col> element inside the <colgroup> element.
answers.b: Add an id to each <td> element and provide a unique id for each; use the ids in your style sheet rules to obtain the desired style.
answers.c: Add a <col> element to the <table> element and define each column by using a <id> element inside the <col> element.
answers.d: Add a <hidden> element to the <table> element and define each column by using a <col> element inside the <hidden> element.

exam.question: Which element can you add to the <table> element to provide a table caption?
What is the blueprint for an object called?
What does JavaScript use as a starting object when constructing a new object?
How is inheritance supported in JavaScript?

answers.a: You replace the prototype of the child object with a new instance of the parent object and then replace the prototype constructor with the child constructor.
answers.b: You call the createChild method on the parent object.
answers.c: You call the setParent method on the child object.

exam.question: You want to locate all the elements on your webpage that are assigned the CSS class name Hidden. Which jQuery statement can you use?
You are interested in writing event-driven JavaScript code that will work on most browsers without writing browser-specific code. How can you accomplish this?

answers.a: Use the jQuery library to help.
answers.b: Use only JavaScript statements that are the same across all browsers.
answers.d: It"s impossible to write event-driven JavaScript code that is not browser-specific.

exam.question: You are interested in locating all &ly;p> elements on your webpage, so your statement is var paragraphs = $("p"). Which line of code would confirm whether at least one element is found?
You are creating a webpage that will collect data and send it to a server. Which element must you implement to be able to send data to the server?
When you retrieve a webpage from the server that contains Customer information, you want to be able to specify the id of the Customer within the URL. What can you use to provide the id?
You have serialized the form data that has an <input type="email"> element. You want to deserialize the data to see the email address as entered. Which function can you use?

You are creating a webpage that prompts for a new user"s profile information. The profile page requires the user to provide a user name, and if no user name is provided, the user will not be able to submit the page to the server. Which attribute must be placed on the user name text box to enforce this requirement?
When you want to send form data to the server to update data in the database, which HTTP method should you specify of the <form> element?
If you want to add a slider control to a webpage, which element do you use?
What can you publish by using npm?
What scoping can a package have? (Choose all that apply.)
Why would you install the express package?

You want to create a REST service for your internal web service and use the HTTP verbs that match CRUD operations. You know the browser your users will be using is compatible, and the firewall will not be a problem. What are the HTTP verbs that match with CRUD (in order)?
What is the primary object used to make an asynchronous AJAX call that returns a JSON result?
You want to use jQuery to make an AJAX call that will use the HTTP POST method. Which jQuery method can you use?
Which method chains asynchronous operations?
Which method creates a resolved promise object?
Which method do you call to subscribe to the successful completion of an asynchronous operation?
Which method do you call on the deferred object to indicate a change in progress?
In the web worker code, you want the asynchronous code to update the DOM. Which method can you use?

answers.d: You cannot update the DOM from within the asynchronous code.

exam.question: Which object can be used when the web worker and the creator need to reference the same object?

answers.d: The web worker and the creator cannot reference the same object.

exam.question: When working with the WebSocket object, which event can be used to retrieve the data that was received from the server?
Which library would you use if you are creating a Node.js website and want to write browser-independent code that uses WebSocket?
You want to ensure that the WebSocket connection is not disconnected as a result of inactivity. How can you accomplish this?

answers.a: Add code to the onclose event to reopen the connection when it"s closed.
answers.b: Add code to send an empty message periodically before the connection is closed.
answers.c: Set the keepAlive property on the WebSocket object to true.
answers.d: Create a new WebSocket object each time you send a message.

exam.question: You want to include a video on your webpage that has an .avi file extension. If you supply the codec information, what will be displayed in browsers that support the <video> element but don"t have the codec?

answers.a: The browser will show the <video> element, but will not play the video.
answers.b: The browser will automatically download the codec and play the video.
answers.c: The browser will display the contents of the <video> element.
answers.d: The browser will automatically download a version of the browser that supports the codec.

exam.question: You don"t want to supply an .ogg video because you find that the .ogg format is choppy and low quality. What other video formats can you include to be compatible with most browsers? (Choose all that apply.)
The W3C standardized using which format for video?

You want to supply an audio file using a format that is compatible with the Internet Explorer, Safari, and Chrome browsers. Which audio formats can you include to be compatible with most browsers? (Choose all that apply.)

You don"t want to supply an .mp3 format because you are concerned about potentially paying royalties. What other audio formats can you include to be compatible with most browsers? (Choose all that apply.)
The <video> and <audio> elements inherit from which object?
If you want your media to repeat continuously, which property would you set to true?
You want to trigger some code when the media is loaded. Which event should you subscribe to?
Which code example can be used to draw a rectangle on a <canvas> element that has an id of myCanvas?
You want to draw an arc that is approximately three-quarters of a circle. Which method is the easiest to use to accomplish this task?
The content of the <svg> element is in which format?
On the <svg> element, what attribute provides a window into the drawing and enables zoom capabilities?
Which of the following events trigger continuously during a drag and drop operation? (Choose all that apply.)
Which of the following events are associated with the item being dragged? (Choose all that apply.)
Using the DataTransfer object, what kind of data can you pass to the drop event?

answers.a: Any valid string, number, date/time, or Boolean value
answers.b: Any URL that is within the same domain as the webpage
answers.d: Any object that can be represented as a string or URL

exam.question: To which events do you need to subscribe to program file drag and drop? (Choose all that apply.)
Which of the following is not a property on the File object?
Which method gets your current location once from the Geolocation object?
Which of the following is not a valid parameter on the getCurrentPosition method?
Which method continuously monitors your current location from the Geolocation object?
Which of the following formulas can you use to calculate the distance between two samples?
Which of the following URLs can access data stored on http://www.example.com/lesson1/page1.html?
What is the web storage limit currently recommended by the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C)?
What is the correct syntax for removing all values existing in localStorage?
Which of the following storage mechanisms has the highest level of cross-browser support?
Which of the following features does web storage support?
Which of the following is not a property of the StorageEvent object?
If you modify a value stored in sessionStorage, which of the following could receive notifications of the change (if subscribed)?

answers.a: Another tab opened to a page on the same domain
answers.b: A second browser window open to the same page
answers.c: An iframe on the same page whose source is within the same domain
answers.d: The operating system that is hosting the browser

exam.question: Which of the following is the correct way to cancel a storage event?

answers.d: Storage events cannot be canceled after they are triggered.

exam.question: Which of the following would be a good candidate for Web SQL?

answers.a: Mobile applications built specifically for Safari on the iOS platform
answers.b: Mobile applications built for any mobile device
answers.d: Mobile applications built specifically for Internet Explorer

exam.question: You need to create a new database. Which of the following commands should you use?
Which of the following will correctly insert a new record, using values passed in as SQL arguments to an executeSql() call?

answers.a: t.executeSql("INSERT INTO books(title) VALUES(?)", ["A Tale of Two Cities"]);
answers.b: t.executeSql("INSERT INTO books(title) VALUES([0])", ["A Tale of Two Cities"]);
answers.c: t.executeSql("INSERT INTO books(title) VALUES([1])", ["A Tale of Two Cities"]);
answers.d: t.executeSql("INSERT INTO books(title) VALUES({0})", ["A Tale of Two Cities"]);

exam.question: Which of the following features is not supported by IndexedDB?
What is the correct method for creating a transaction that will add a new record?
Which object store method retrieves a record by its key value?
Which of the following methods should you use when storing files that are relatively unimportant and can be removed if the browser is low in available space?
Which of the following allows FileWriter to append data to the end of the file?
Which of the following removes a directory that contains existing files?
Which of the following is a valid statement for the first line of a manifest file?
Which event is fired after an existing cache has been updated with new resources?
